item.title: 中国股市交易低迷，投资者仍在讨论下一步行动
item.description: 周二早盘，中国股市出现波动，关于反弹能走多远的争论日益激烈。【原文：Chinese stocks fluctuated in early trading Tuesday amid growing debate over how far the rally can go.】

item.title: 中国网络机构在新报告中驳斥美国的黑客攻击指控
item.description: 中国网络安全机构再次驳斥了美国和微软公司今年早些时候的说法，即中国黑客是对美国关键计算机网络发动的名为 "伏特台风 "的高调攻击的幕后黑手。【原文：China’s cybersecurity agency again rejected claims by the US and Microsoft Corp. from earlier this year that Chinese hackers were behind a high-profile attack on critical American computer networks known as Volt Typhoon.】

item.title: 马来西亚 2025 年预算计划交易者指南
item.description: 马来西亚政府明年的支出计划旨在提高工资水平和维持经济增长，因此马来西亚的消费类和建筑类股票将从中受益。【原文：Malaysia’s consumer and construction stocks are set to benefit as the government seeks to boost wages and sustain economic growth with its spending plan for next year.】

item.title: 澳大利亚最大养老金公司称中国繁荣期已结束
item.description: 澳大利亚最大养老基金的投资总监表示，中国最新一轮刺激政策可能有助于稳定该国的房地产危机，但投资者应为经济繁荣时期的结束做好准备。【原文：China’s latest bout of stimulus may help stabilize the country’s property crisis but investors should position for the end of the economy’s boom years, says the investment chief of Australia’s largest pension fund.】

item.title: 美国大选刺激关税押注，交易员认为人民币波动更剧烈
item.description: 由于交易商担心如果唐纳德-特朗普在竞争激烈的美国总统竞选中获胜，中国出口商品将面临被征收关税的风险，衡量人民币波动预期的一个指标徘徊在近两年来的最高点附近。【原文：A gauge of expected yuan swings is hovering around the highest in nearly two years as traders brace for the risk of tariffs on Chinese exports if Donald Trump wins the tightly contested US Presidential race.】

item.title: 新西兰政府敦促新西兰央行促进银行竞争
item.description: 新西兰政府不断向储备银行施压，要求其利用监管权力鼓励更多的银行业竞争。【原文：New Zealand’s government is keeping the pressure on the Reserve Bank to use its regulatory powers to encourage more banking competition.】

item.title: 美国考虑限制英伟达和 AMD 向一些国家出口人工智能芯片
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，拜登政府官员已经讨论过对英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）和其他美国公司的先进人工智能芯片的销售设置国别上限，此举将限制一些国家的人工智能能力。【原文：Biden administration officials have discussed capping sales of advanced AI chips from Nvidia Corp. and other American companies on a country-specific basis, people familiar with the matter said, a move that would limit some nations’ artificial intelligence capabilities.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利称私人信贷可降低系统性风险
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，尽管缺乏提高银行资本要求的政治意愿，但私人信贷市场的崛起可能会降低美国金融体系的系统性风险。【原文：The rise of the private credit market may lead to less systemic risk in the US financial system despite a lack of political appetite for increasing bank capital requirements, Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said.】

item.title: 交易员权衡加息路径，中东忧虑缓解，黄金保持稳定
item.description: 由于交易商消化了美国一位高级政策制定者暗示可能放缓货币宽松步伐的言论，同时由于对中东冲突升级的担忧减弱，避险需求下降，黄金保持小幅下跌。【原文：Gold held a small decline as traders digested comments from a senior US policymaker that suggested a slower pace of monetary easing may be likely, while haven demand fell amid fading concerns about an escalation in Middle East conflicts.】

item.title: MBK 称已获得大量股份，韩国锌业股价上涨
item.description: 韩国锌业公司（Korea Zinc Co.）的股价最高上涨了 1.9%，此前收购公司 MBK Partners 表示，它已获得了足够大的股份，这有助于它在一场备受关注的收购战中赢得对这家世界顶级锌精炼商的控制权。【原文：Korea Zinc Co. shares rose as much as 1.9% after buyout firm MBK Partners said it has acquired a large enough stake to help it win control of the world’s top zinc refiner in a closely watched takeover battle.】

item.title: 央行行长罕见地表示支持增加黄金储备
item.description: 各国央行购买黄金是金银今年创纪录大涨的主要推动力。但官员们很少提前发出购买黄金的信号。【原文：Gold purchases from central banks have been a key driver in bullion’s record-smashing rally this year. But officials rarely signal ahead of time when buying is top of mind.】

item.title: 威利斯称新西兰经济将对降息做出反应
item.description: 新西兰政府在即将迎来执政第一年之际大谈经济前景，称利率下降和财政纪律将在明年重振需求。【原文：New Zealand’s government is talking up the economic outlook as it approaches its first year in office, saying falling interest rates and fiscal discipline will revive demand next year.】

item.title: 香港领导人将在演讲中重点谈经济和减免酒税
item.description: 香港领导人将在本周的年度演讲中把促进经济作为优先事项，并借此制定一项议程，其中包括可能削减酒税，以及可能采取措施加强香港作为金融中心的地位。【原文：Hong Kong’s leader will make bolstering the economy a priority in an annual speech this week, using it to lay out an agenda that includes a potential cut to a liquor tax and possible measures to strengthen the city’s status as a finance center.】

item.title: 亚洲美元贷款连续第三年下降，创历史新高
item.description: 日本以外的亚太地区美元贷款额预计将连续第三年下降，原因是预计剩余几个月内将缺乏巨额交易，这与早先的增长预测背道而驰。【原文：Asia Pacific dollar loan volume outside Japan is projected to fall for a third year due to a lack of jumbo deals expected in the remaining months, bucking earlier growth predictions.】

item.title: 亚洲股市有望追随美国股市涨势；石油下跌：市场综述
item.description: 随着华尔街股市再创历史新高，亚洲股市也将继续保持强劲表现。由于对以色列袭击伊朗能源设施的担忧有所缓解，石油价格下跌。【原文：Asian shares are poised to follow the lead of another strong performance on Wall Street, with stocks hitting fresh all-time highs. Oil dropped as concerns eased about Israel attacking Iranian energy facilities.】

item.title: 财新网报道：中国或将筹资 8460 亿美元提振经济
item.description: 据中国媒体《财新网》报道，中国可能在三年内从超长期特别国债中筹集6万亿元人民币（约合8,460亿美元），作为提振萎靡不振的经济的努力的一部分。【原文：China may raise 6 trillion yuan ($846 billion) from ultra-long special government bonds over three years as part of its efforts to boost the sputtering economy, Chinese media outlet Caixin reported.】

item.title: 以色列不会以伊朗原油为目标的报道令石油跌势扩大
item.description: 在以色列可能避免将伊朗的原油基础设施作为袭击目标的报道缓解了人们对中东紧张局势的担忧之后，石油继续下跌。【原文：Oil extended losses after a report that Israel may avoid targeting Iran’s crude infrastructure eased concerns over tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 中国摩天大楼空置引发开发商价格战
item.description: 中国最大的城市中，越来越多金碧辉煌的摩天大楼几乎没有半满，这引发了更多房东削减租金。【原文：China’s biggest cities are seeing a growing array of gleaming skyscrapers that are barely half-full, trigging more landlords to cut rents.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表对墨西哥司法改革表示担忧
item.description: 乔-拜登总统的贸易主管表示，墨西哥全面的司法改革引发了美国对其第一大贸易伙伴的质疑，美国需要了解与墨西哥新领导人的合作范围。【原文：President Joe Biden’s trade chief said Mexico’s sweeping judicial overhaul spurred questions for the US about its top trade partner and a need to understand the scope for collaboration with its new leader.】

item.title: 投资者推高澳元看涨押注
item.description: 早上好，我是悉尼的乔吉。以下是您今天需要了解的内容......今日必读：- 投资者看好澳元- 阿尔巴内斯领导的工党民调下滑- Tribeca 的明星基金经理刘俊蓓将成立新公司【原文：Good morning, it's Georgie here in Sydney. Here’s what you need to know today...Today’s must-reads:• Investors bullish on Aussie dollar• Albanese’s Labor slips in the polls• Tribeca’s star fund manager Jun Bei Liu to start new firm】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司将在下一个战略计划中尽可能开采石油
item.description: 巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）正努力从巴西现有油田中开采出尽可能多的石油，同时寻找新的储量，以防止产量在 2030 年代开始下降。【原文：Petrobras is pushing to extract as much oil as possible from its existing fields in Brazil while simultaneously hunting for new reserves to prevent production from starting to decline in the 2030s.】

item.title: 微软人工智能副总裁布贝克将加入 OpenAI
item.description: 微软公司表示，其人工智能副总裁塞巴斯蒂安-布贝克（Sebastien Bubeck）即将离职，加入OpenAI。【原文：Microsoft Corp. said one of its artificial intelligence vice presidents, Sebastien Bubeck, is leaving to join OpenAI, where Microsoft is both the largest investor and a rival.】

item.title: 特斯拉 "擎天柱 "机器人在 Cybercab 活动上进行远程操作
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，特斯拉公司在最近的一次活动中使用人类远程控制其 Optimus 机器人原型的某些功能，旨在激发投资者对即将推出的产品的热情。【原文：Tesla Inc. used humans to remotely control some capabilities of its Optimus robot prototypes at a recent event designed to generate investor enthusiasm for forthcoming products, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 谷歌在 "启明星 "协议中支持建设小型核反应堆
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司正在投资开发新一代核能，支持一家正在建造小型模块化反应堆的公司，并同意在这些反应堆开始向美国电网供电后购买能源。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google is investing in the development of the next generation of nuclear power, backing a company that’s building small modular reactors and agreeing to purchase energy once the sites start supplying US grids.】

item.title: 德意志银行股东正寻求出售 2.79 亿美元的股份
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的一位单一股东正在出售这家德国贷款机构的约 1600 万股股份。【原文：A single shareholder of Deutsche Bank AG is offering to sell around 16 million shares in the German lender, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: CD&R计划采取措施缓解法国对赛诺菲交易的担忧
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，由于政治上担心收购赛诺菲消费者保健业务的控股权可能损害法国的利益，Clayton Dubilier & Rice 公司正在制定一揽子承诺。【原文：Clayton Dubilier & Rice is working on a package of commitments amid political concerns that its purchase of a controlling stake in Sanofi’s consumer health business could damage French interests, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 意大利通过税率和减税措施向企业征税 40 亿欧元
item.description: 据熟悉意大利政府预算计划的人士透露，意大利政府正通过调整部分税收起征点和取消某些税收减免项目，向企业征收 40 亿欧元（44 亿美元）的税款。【原文：Italy’s government is targeting €4 billion ($4.4 billion) from companies by adjusting some tax thresholds and eliminating certain tax deductions, according to people familiar with its budget plans.】

item.title: Tele2 任命 Xavier Niel Play 波兰公司前负责人为首席执行官
item.description: 法国亿万富翁泽维尔-尼尔（Xavier Niel）今年早些时候大量入股的瑞典电信运营商 Tele2 AB 已选择尼尔的挑战者品牌 Play Poland 的前负责人担任新的首席执行官。【原文：Tele2 AB, the Swedish telecom operator that French billionaire Xavier Niel took a sizable stake in earlier this year, has chosen the former head of Niel’s challenger brand Play Poland as its new chief executive officer.】

item.title: 摩根大通聘请德意志银行的 Trey Hanlan 负责医疗保健交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. has hired health-care banker Trey Hanlan as a managing director on the mid-cap investment banking team, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Eskom 要求将价格提高 36% 归咎于南非政治
item.description: 南非国有电力公司表示，由于政府无法控制拖欠的市政当局，以及监管机构在裁决先前的提价申请时出现失误，该公司不得不要求提价 36%。【原文：South Africa’s state-owned power utility said it had to ask for 36% increase in prices because of the government’s inability to rein in delinquent municipalities and errors made by the regulator in adjudicating earlier applications to boost tariffs.】
